item.message: The main purpose of training is that a man should begin to imbibe within him as much of godly attributes as possible.

Rise before dawn. Offer your prayer and puja at a fixed hour preferably before sunrise, sitting in one and the same pose. Have a separate place and seat for worship. Purity of mind and body should be specially adhered to.
It is a scientific principle upon which the division of the timings for puja and Sandhya is based in accordance with the natural effect of the time.
In fact it (Reality) is all the sphere of Tam and Tam alone. This is the only thing worth achieving for a true yogi.
The state of negation which one craves for and which is the real life, abides in it (Tam) and all activities cease before one reaches the point.
People have lost sight of the true Reality which is beyond both light and darkness.
Satyapad is itself a science for which one may not be well fitted unless he develops the capacity to perceive Nature with his inner eyes.

When one resolves to do a thing, the connecting link between the thought and the work becomes intensified, and one begins to draw power from the real source in accordance with the strength of his thought.
item.kcn: Lion-hearted men alone dare approach Reality and men are made so, by Natural Path

item.message: Performing of Sandhya before sunrise is stressed upon for the reason that the external heat and other influences, which have been driven out of the body, may not creep in again by the effect of the sun which would prevent our deriving the best advantage of the time.
For picking up the pearls one must oneself dive deep into the ocean.
It is better to sit in the grey of the morning for meditation.
SWAMI VIVEKANANDA'S BIRTHDAY It is Raja Yoga alone that can successfully lead a man up to the highest level of approach - Swami Vivekananda
item.kcn: Swami Vivekannda defense of Sankhya Involution vs Darwin's Evolution

item.message: In principle the devotee or abhyasi should present himself before the Master in the same manner as a soldier does at the time of parade.
Our first and the foremost commandment relates to the proper observance of Sandhya and Upasana. By following it we begin to draw in power which we have finally to attain due course.
There must be yielding attitude towards the master.
If we make our heart the target of masterly force we begin to expand inside, with the result that in the long run we find ourselves stretching throughout the Godly empire.
We proceed with meditation on the heart thinking of the Divine Light within, and by so doing we gradually begin to rise or to express it better, to dive deep into the inner consciousness.
Meditation really means that the mind may be accustomed to the centre itself instead of wandering elsewhere. Meditation on heart is prescribed for that purpose.
Please think only once that Godly light within is attracting you.
When we meditate, the central power we have remains in force.
It is at this point(Heart) that the connecting link between the animate and the inanimate is most clearly felt.
When you acquire a state of permanency in your meditation, touching the innermost plane, the idea of the Ultimate or God becomes quite near you.

If we try to retain the effect gained by meditation for the most part of the day, and abide in the same state for as long as we can, we are in a way in constant remembrance of God and our progress is easy and rapid.
You should only meditate. You should not struggle with the ideas and thoughts which generally come in during meditation.
When his (Man's) downward tendency is checked, the thought of reaching the Origin automatically revives in his heart.

Meditation only at a certain fixed hour is not enough, for we are thus in touch with the sacred thought only for a while after which we have no idea of God whatsoever and are for most part of the day away from the path of service and devotion.
One must be regular in the abhyas. If interest in meditation is created, half the work is done.
It (the process of cleaning) will help you in purging your mind and make you receptive of the efficacious influence of our great Master.
The density of the thought can only be removed if we take to the subtle method.
While meditating, if you secure even a temporary lull, that means you have gone a step further on the path.
The divine experiences are the perceptions of the conditions relating to Divinity.

Our Great Master has boldly asserted that one can, for sure, attain liberation in this very life, nay, even in a part of it, provided one is really earnest about it and has the fortune of having a proper guide.
We should utilize this occasion in getting into the Master and Master alone, which will act as food and tonic for spiritual elevation.
Now since times are changing, as I have hinted at in 'Efficacy of Raj Yoga', only such means as introduced by our Revered Master Mahatma Ram Chandraji shall be in vogue throughout the world.
If we are deep-rooted in meditation, we connect our link with the innermost thing desired.
Waiting is also a sort of intense remembrance which is greatly beneficial to spirituality.
The knowledge of the Divine is a science.
'I' consciousness remains far and near, and it disappears also, if we do our abhyas devotedly.
"Awake, O sleepers, it's the hour of the dawn".
By meditation we create a temporary lull in our mind and calmness prevails for the time during which we are in touch with the divine force.
The external ways adopted for the purpose (attainment of purity) began to cast their effect upon the mind and thus the internal purity too began to develop.
Purity starts from being and impurities are the result of the wrong suggestions and improper utilization of the inner environment.
The mind, which in its primordial state was absolutely pure and regulated has now been spoiled and polluted by our wrong ways and doings.
Really the path nearest to yourself is the path nearest to God.
The Preliminary step in the right type of training is that the aspirant's tendencies of mind be directed towards God.
The grace of my Master Supreme has enabled us again to assemble here and feel the cozy warmth of the sunshine of His everlasting benignance.

Our Great Master has boldly asserted that one can, for sure, attain liberation in this very life, nay, even in a part of it, provided one is really earnest about it and has the fortune of having a proper guide.
Constant growth of lightness of mind and spirit is the surest test of spiritual progress.
Heaviness of mind or internal denseness caused by gross forms of worship is a great impediment to our spiritual advancement and should be avoided.
The grace or effect of higher centres remains far apart due to the grossness and complexities we have made.
For every grain of knowledge the wisdom required must be at least ten times greater.
The training under Natural Path starts from Karan Sharir (causal body) where the impressions are in seedling form.
Under the system the dormant energies of the Centre and sub-centres are awakened so as to enable them to function properly.
The real state of enlightenment comes when we get into full consciousness of the condition of enlivenment and after imbibing its effect, secure merging in it.
The most important factor in realization is self-confidence in our own capacity and power to achieve success.
A little inclination towards the attainment of the Reality, will start weaving the future.
Attachment with God results in detachment from the world, and that is true vairagya.
We are failing in our sacred duty if we do not exert ourselves for the discharge of our responsibilities pertaining either to this or to the next world.
The feeling of Vairagya in the real sense and with the lasting results can only be developed after thorough cleaning and due moderation.
They are mostly dogmatic instead of Godmatic.
Renunciation truly means non-attachment with worldly objects and not the non-possession of things.
The real form of Viveka is that when a man begins to realize his own defects and shortcomings and the bottom of his heart feels repentant for them..
It (Vairagya) is simply an inner feeling which turns our heart away from all that is superfluous for our normal living.
I do not agree with those who hold the view that the only means of cultivating non-attachment is to get away from home and family and retire to a solitary corner discarding all worldly ties.
Begin your puja with a prayer for spiritual elevation with a heart full of love (devotion).

The reason why prayer should be offered with a heart full of love and devotion is that one should create within himself a state of vacuity so that the flow of Divine Grace may be diverted towards him.
By prayer, we come nearer to our goal because we come in contact with the Being.
In prayer we stand before Him as an humble supplicant presenting to Him our true state and completely resigning ourselves to His will.
Constant practice brings a man to a state in which he begins to feel himself in prayer all through.
The state of prayer is that of a devotee and it is strengthened by love and devotion.
At the time of prayer we adopt supplicant mood and becomes very near to surrender.
No particular time is fixed for the prayer. One can do it when he feels inclined to it or else he should try to create a disposition for it when required
When a man creates in himself a strong craving for the Absolute, he is indeed in a state of prayer and it is for everyone to strive for it.
It is also sheer folly to pray to the Great Master for worldly gains except in most special cases.
Swimming is the part of swimmer and to teach swimming is the part of master.
While doing a thing, think that you are not doing it for yourself, but for your Master, or rather think that your Master himself is doing it for himself.
Love is the inner awakening to Reality.
Devotion makes our passage smooth and creates a channel for the Godly current to flow into our heart.
Through thinking of the Divine, devotion and love develop.
By devotion to the Highest, we make a channel from us to Him that serves as a path to Him.
Love makes every task easy and paves the way for the shower of Master's grace to smoothen the way to the Ultimate Goal.
The remembrance of everything should merge into the remembrance of One - the Ultimate.
Under Natural Path the master, by the application of his inner powers, awakens to action and accelerates the dormant forces in the abhyasi and diverts the flow of Divine current towards his heart.

Under our system of spiritual training, the teacher at the very outset weakens the downward tendency of the Abhyasi by the effect of his own power, so that it may get automatically diverted towards the Divine
The real spiritual training is that which makes our mind disciplined and regulated, restores moderation in senses and faculties and creates lightness of spirit.
Having attained the state of realisation one develops an unfailing will in the spiritual sphere.
Under the system of 'Natural Path' it (inner cleaning) is accomplished by easy mental practices, aided by the power transmitted by the teacher.

Under the system, though the spiritual training is imparted through transmission, still the most important and indispensable thing remains for the abhyasi to develop in himself. It is love and devotion to supplement the abhyas.
'We are and we are not' as also 'we are not and we are'
Transmission gives a new life to the sleeping condition of man, and prepares for the highest approach reserved for human beings.
As long as the abhyasi is not getting the Grace direct, the teacher diverts the Grace which is coming directly upon himself to the abhyasi.
As the transmission takes us to deeper and deeper levels of remembrance, our journey to the source becomes firmly established.
In our system a teacher takes out the hurdles in the progress of the seeker and side by side imparts the divine effulgence in him.
Subtle force is very strong, and if an abhyasi tries to go further by his own effort, he is pushed down because he cannot get at the subtle force.
I may assure you that spiritual training for the attainment of higher stages is only possible by the process of Yogic transmission and by no other means.
In our sanstha, Reality is infused at the first stroke of will which serves as the seed in the long run.

The condition of Ajapa rightly believed to be a high spiritual achievement acquired after years of hard labour, is only a matter of weeks or rather days, through right training by the process of transmission.
It is really the practical experience only that can help one to realize himself.
Under the Natural Path, one has simply to connect one-self with the power of the master whose mind, senses and faculties are all thoroughly disciplined and regulated.
If somehow we turn its( human mind's) downward trend towards the Base, it will become quite calm and peaceful.
Physical or mental troubles do not tell upon spirituality.
Fix your goal which should be complete oneness with God. Rest not till the ideal is achieved.
If you meditate having your real goal before you, you are sure to arrive at the destination.
What is the Destination, where we have to reach? It may, preferably, be called insignificance. If you chose to designate it as such, it is an insignificance, of which we know nothing!
There must be one and only one goal so that one may not form different channels for the different goals.
Realisation is not at all difficult for those who have the real craving for it.
One thing which I especially lay stress upon is that the abhyasi must cultivate an intense craving amounting to restless, eagerness or pinching impatience for the realisation of the goal.
The burning desire for Realisation brings the goal nearer.
It is very essential for everyone to fix his thought, at the very outset, upon the goal which he has to attain so that his thought and will may pave his way upto it.
Remembrance should be in a way that we feel the thought of remembrance oozing out from the objects everywhere.
When we thus get awakened to the sense of duty and the idea of God becomes prominent in our hearts, we begin to treat realization as the primary object of life.
The idea of Guru as the Supreme Divine force is very helpful in spiritual pursuit.
We should attempt the finite for the Infinite.
The kingly thing in us is thought which ultimately develops, steering us to our goal.
The spiritual path can be discovered only when one keeps the destination ever in view.
If we go on pursuing our practice of Sadhana without having the final aim in view, our position will be that of a traveller who travels on without any idea of a destination
One of the essential things necessary for the achievement of negation is the growth of intense craving amounting to restless impatience, combined with sincere love and devotion.
When restlessness increases and reaches the limit, crosses the limit of strength, then the beginning of real peace starts.
Our intention to reach the goal promoted our efforts, and since the Ideal was the noblest, the interest for it went on increasing till it developed into a strong craving.
Pujya Sri Ramchandraji Maharaj Birthday - My heart remains connected with you all, here and elsewhere, giving impulse in unbroken silence to affect the hearts naturally in due course.
When all of my associates gather at one spot, it becomes a temple for me and it is their duty to make their hearts as the temple themselves.
We are here again to take stock of our work on the path of the Master Almighty for the benefit of His children of all ages and climes.
Longing for Reality brings a person to the right path. It gives a new life to the sleeping condition of a man and prepares him for the highest approach reserved for human beings.

If you really aspire, in good faith, for the attainment of the Absolute, all that you are to do is to turn your attention that way with full sincerity of heart, linking your-self closely with One-ultimate Reality.
The final point of approach is where every kind of force, power, activity or even stimulus disappears and a man enters a state of complete negation; Nothingness or Zero.
If somehow one is relieved of the idea of body or the soul even, he gets closest to that, one craves for.
Anything short of liberation cannot be taken as the goal of life although there remains still a lot beyond it.
No doubt the world will be paradise but for that we have to work very hard.
It is generally admitted that the goal must be the highest, otherwise progress up to the final limit is doubtful.
A real seeker is he who all along with his state of tranquility, feels a restless craving for the realisation of the Ultimate.
Proceed towards Unknown. Love Him who loves all. Destination is not far off. Remembrance is the instrument.
To reach the Infinite Absolute is one of the primary duties of man.
When one has got a mind and a strong sincere desire to reach the state of Realisation, he will surely get the means to take him to the state of Realisation.
Whoever moves one step towards it(Goal), the goal advances ten steps towards that one.
A man can be a real man only when his eye is diverted towards his inner self.

Faith in reality, faith in the right course you have adopted for realization, faith in the worthy master whom you have submitted to, this is the rock upon which you must build your edifice of spirituality if you really aim at success.
For making one-self deserving one must have his goal and his present position clearly in his view.
Divine help does come, no doubt, but only when the Supreme is convinced of devotee's earnestness of purpose.
The only way to free ourselves from the entanglements is to divert our attention from them and fix our eyes on the very Real thing.
There cannot be any breakdown in spirituality, if faith and desire for the Ultimate is there.
All of us are proceeding towards Divinity or the goal of life - some consciously and some unconsciously.
Spirituality is a sort of feeling or consciousness of the Highest.It is the doorway to enter into Divinity pure and simple i.e. the Highest Evenness all along.
Silence is a part of a few grains of Spirituality and not the Reality itself.
The conception of the Guru as a spiritual mother promotes within us the feelings of love, reverence and surrender which are the main factors of a spiritual life.
We know that God is completely devoid of grossness, so the realisation of God must mean the attainment of a state of similar subtleness to the last possible degree.
If somehow or other they make a firm determination to reach the Reality, the power of Master shall affect them.

At higher levels the conditions are such that even if one ascends a little by selfeffort, he quickly slips down because of the strong push from above. So, for our entry into higher regions, the Master's help is indispensable.
It is only when a worthy master of calibre comes up to our help, that we are able to tear them (bondages) off in order to make our passage to the Absolute Reality smooth and easy.
The natural yearning of soul is to be free from bondage. If there is one who does not like to free himself from the entanglements there is no solution for him.
God is known to be both samavarti and samadarshi.
A powerful will made at the very first step and maintained all through, shall never fail to achieve complete success.
Guru is the connecting link between God and man.
Having God is the real subject of spirituality.
A man who is himself free can free you from eternal bondage.
For realising Him we have ourselves to become god-like.
To find the way back by unravelling the strands binding us may not be possible except with the help of a guide who has connected himself to the Source.
One who can foment us by his own inner powers would be the best for a guide in the spiritual pursuit.
Gurumata disciples are those who obey the commands of the master in all matters and try to submit to his will in all possible ways.
The only thing for the abhyasi to do is to connect himself with the power of the master, whose mind and senses are all thoroughly disciplined and regulated.
My revered master, Samarth Guru Mahatma Ram Chandraji Maharaj of Fatehgarh, has rendered wonderful service to humanity in this respect by providing the easiest means of gaining the object of life.
One who can foment you with his own internal divine power to make your task easy, is the only capable hand for spiritual guidance.
If anybody wants that he should get benefited, he should encourage himself to cultivate right faith, right cognition, and right morals.

Indeed our Great Master has boldly asserted that one can, for sure, attain liberation in this very life, nay, even in a part of it, provided one is really earnest about it and has the fortune of having a proper guide.
Thus the thing goes on and the time comes when grossness bids farewell and subtleness also loses its charm.
The beauty of the training of my master is that spiritual life runs parallel to the life in the world, with ever increasing efficiency.
I believe He can better be sought for in the midst of one's own heart. But for that purpose, the spirit of the Spartans is necessary.
The goal of life is easily reached if we are devoted to it, having idea of our Master all the way through.
What we stand in need of, from a Guru is the true impulse to effect the awakening of the soul.
The help of the Master, who has himself travelled the entire distance and has developed in himself the Divine force, is therefore of immense value.
Total vacuum is God alone. When we merge in Divinity, the state of vacuum begins to dissolve itself; it comes to the Nearest.
If a grain of Reality be gained; it so invaluable that the entire riches of the world can not be its ransom.
Be plain and simple to be identical with Nature.
One should lead a simple and pious life absorbed in constant Divine Consciousness, discharging properly at the same time all his worldly responsibilities and duties.
Nature too helps us in the process by creating a field for bhog in order to remove the impressions of our thoughts and actions from the causal body.
When we were born into this world for the first time we were pure, because the source from which we have descended or come down is purity.
To acquire naturalness should be the main care of the abhyasi.
As a matter of fact Reality, which one aspires for, is so simple that its very simplicity has become a veil to it.
One must go on reducing the activities, shaking off all superfluities that have entered into his being, for the purpose of shattering his individual network.
He (abhyasi) must also cultivate habits which will be conducive to his efforts of shattering the network.
If any of you breed the divine thoughts, mind will grasp it and will not eject them because, it is the real nature of mind since it has come from the real Artery.
As you think, so you become.
Real love develops in purer mind, having its Nature Divine.
We are searching for the potentiality which creates consciousness, and if that too is gone then we find ourselves on the verge of true Reality, pure and simple.
Reality dawns upon him alone who goes back along with Nature making himself subtler and subtler.
We should attempt the finite for the Infinite
If we drag ourselves towards the world, things of fear begin to display their character and when we are towards the Divinity, Divinity plays in Divinity itself.
It (Knot 2) is known as the seat of atman. Cleanliness and simplicity are the characteristic features of this state. A feeling of moderation is also experienced to a certain extent.
We are a part of the cycle of this existence or in plain words, we are a part of Nature. We should abide by Nature and not try to beat the Nature.
It is very easy to talk about the creation but as to what part we have to play in it remains always silent.
If all the things are changed to co-operate with the Nature, balance develops and that is what we want.
We should always take the broader view of things and widen it so that it may be able to cross its own boundary.
Be truthful. Take miseries as Divine Blessings for your own good and be thankful.
The mystery of the problem will be clear if we look into the origin of miseries.
Constant brooding over our own afflictions increases our worries.
Total absence of sufferings and miseries in life is, however, impossible and unnatural.
To put up coolly with miseries and troubles contributes much to our betterment; hence they are valuable assets to our progress.
We are benefited by the disease also which takes along with it the vicious 'Samskaras'. All is the play of His love.
One who is born in this world is sure to taste miseries.
Impressions remain on our causal body so long as they are not wiped off through the process of 'Bhog'.
Diversion from the path of duty is in fact not due to circumstances or outside engagements, but only to the misdirected activities of the indisciplined mind.
We cultivate a habit of truthfulness so that our actions and dealings may be in consonance with the state 'It is as it is'.
We must march on the path of realization like a brave soldier with full faith and confidence, not minding the difficulties or reverses.
When impure 'Samskaras' come into 'Bhog', the eyes of the creator are towards us.
Really speaking, the difficulties are the operations of Nature for our good.
Mere consciousness of God cures many of the evils of the mind and removes difficulties from our path.
A true devotee is one who loves Him not for any favour or worldly interest but merely for love's sake.
It is only realization in the right sense that makes a true yogi or saint.
The abhyasi should always look to the bright side of the picture and should not,at any rate, submit himself to the feeling of despondency which is a great obstacle in the path.
Suffering is the root and results are flowers which every associate should strive hard to have.
A warrior is never nervous on the field, because he has some aim before him.
If a man wants to work out the problems of his life easily, he should give right suggestions to the mind.
Demolition of the Past is a chapter in Natural path
Know all people as thy brethren and treat them as such.
We are all brethren connected intellectually, morally and spiritually - the main goal of human life.
We are united in the common cause keeping towards proper order the good of man and humanity.
One has to remove only the brokenness and he will feel the love flowing equally to one and all, and it becomes universal.
World peace is closely related with the peace of the individual for which one has to take into account the inner state of one's mind.
Whenever you think of anything, the idea comes first at'A'. Whatever you think repeatedly, located at the point 'A', you will form your fate accordingly.
If man's mind is brought to the state of peace and order, everything in the outside world will get into order in the same colour.
Only remove the hatred, I say, and universal love is there.
It is now the regime of Lord Krishna which is to continue till the next avatar comes into the world.
The effect of the activities of the lower consciousness settles down upon the subconscious mind forming fate.
Life in family is a life worth having, because in it we learn how to love others.
God has created the world so that every flower may grow in its right standard.
I would define a Mahatma as the most insignificant being or rather a neglected figure, beyond all feelings of greatness, pride or egoism, dwelling permanently in a state of complete self-negation.

PUJYA DR. K.C.VARADACHARI BIRTHDAY - The word mahatma has been defined in several or various ways, not perhaps without some reasonable basis. But my definition of it as a 'non-being person', though somewhat peculiar, is meaningful.
The work of the Mission will save the humanity from its doom by carrying the teachings of Master to every heart.
SRI KRISHNA JANMASHTAMI - Lord Krishna had originally introduced bhakti in Raja Yoga in a way the yogis know, because he knew the time was at hand when life would be uncertain.
It is all absorbing attachment (bondage) to Reality alone, which liberates one from every other bondage.
We should try only to build the future and not waste our time in thinking of the past.
The world will soon realise that no nation on the surface of the earth can survive without spirituality as its base.
Service to fellow beings is service to God in the real sense, if it is not done out of any selfish motive.
It was all really the effect of our own thoughts and actions that converted brothers and friends into strangers.
The development of the feeling of universal brotherhood means the breaking up of the individual network that separated one from the other, and the closer adherence to the tie of fraternity.
Let the light of the Real, shine in the heart of everyone so that we may rise up to the expectations of the Divine!
This world is in fact a reflection of the other world(Astral world).
Be not revengeful for the wrongs done by others. Take them with gratitude as heavenly gifts.
He (Rev.Lalaji Maharaj) used to say, "Our home is the training ground of patience and endurance."
The Natural Path provides a system in which, while living a normal worldly life in the way that all our actions may become penances themselves, we try to achieve our highest Goal - The Ultimate.
Service and sacrifice are the two main instruments with which we build the temple of spirituality, love of course being the fundamental basis.
Truly speaking, we ourselves are the makers of fate.
The real cause of anger is usually one's own refractory temperament.
Take everything as coming from the Lord, so that the feelings of resentment may not arise.
The greatest obstruction on the path of spirituality is offered by our feelings of partiality and prejudice, which may be roughly assumed as a type of ahamkara.
Prejudice is the greatest evil, rather the deadliest poison to spiritual life.
The end of desires means the stopping of the formation of Samskaras.
The external help comes in the form of suffering caused by the wrongs done by others, against which the people generally poison their thought on account of their own ignorance.
We should do our duty to uplift the mankind not minding whether they are doing their duty towards us properly.
When we do something by applying our head and heart we form impressions
The disturbed state of mind is more often due to the tyranny of one's own heart and to a brooding nature.
We should never act in such a way that anyone can lift a finger against us.
Another external thing necessary for the beginner is that he should practice restraint in thought, word and deed so as not to injure the feelings and prick the hearts of others.
Thoughts have life and they also work on the lives of others.
If the practice is systematically done on both these points (Pt.A and Pt.B), desires will soon begin to bid farewell.
We blow our own trumpet in our own thoughts, and lose a lot in the process.
By the effect of our vicious thoughts and actions we spoil our sense of discrimination and right cognition.
When we remain in contact with ideas and thoughts of different kinds, they leave impressions upon our emotional feelings and senses.
The best way to get rid of them (thoughts) is to be unmindful towards them and treat them as you treat uninvited guests.
Our present degenerated state is the reaction of thoughts, and by the help of thoughts alone will we be able to evolve our-selves.
If a man wants to work out the problems of his life easily, he should give right suggestions to the mind.
Our actions and thoughts count much in our wrong making.
When a man goes on with his usual work, of whatever nature it might be, in the sense of duty having no weight or impression of it upon his heart, he spoils neither himself nor the cosmos.
I would therefore prefer to induce people to forget themselves instead of knowing themselves.
When we are really quite unconscious of the very presence of peace, we are in true sense free from the impression or the weight of the feeling.
Perfect peace is one of its high stages, although the real thing is still onwards, when even the consciousness of peace fails.
When you have a mind to do the work for the good of humanity, you will naturally get it.
To him who might be eager to have experience of that Infinite plane, I may say that he must step into it after brushing aside all the effects of feelings.
Bhog does not only mean undergoing the effect of our past actions but it really means passing through the process of unfolding the intricacies of the point which we have already arrived at.
Anything that comes to us for our ultimate good, may it be from any medium, fills our heart with delight and promotes in us a sense of gratitude.

Our belongings are a pile of Samskaras (impressions) with their resultant effects in the form of complexities and the diverse coverings, which we have gathered round the soul and which are the results of our thoughts and actions.
True faith is really an unspeakable virtue which is beyond the scope of religion.
Be happy to eat in constant Divine thought whatever you get, with due regard to honest and pious earnings.
Happiest man is he, who is happy under all circumstances, and that is the part of a saint.
It is a hidden dictum of Nature that every soul must live a happy and restful life.
A happy disposition is a state which percolates its effect upon the lower layers and purifies them.
While taking food we fix our thought upon the Ultimate which we have finally to attain, in order to take in its effect too, and increase our purity all the more
Our rules provide for taking food in the remembrance of God.
The thing got from Nature is very pure because its basis is purity. The thing earned by man can also remain in a pure state when that is got through pure and pious means.
If it(Food)is taken meditating all the while on God it will cure all kinds of spiritual diseases and remove things which hinder our progress.
The power of Prana being all pervasive, nothing is free from its influence. It is inside the food as well as outside it.
A man should have the desire of drinking the whole river of spirituality.
If one can sell his heart, i.e. make a gift of it to the Divine Master, hardly anything more remains to be done.
Self surrender is nothing but a state of complete resignation to the will of the master, with total disregard of self.
We get power from our thought. It happens only when we create perfect harmony between things of our making and those of the Divine.
Whatever act you do, do it in the thought "It is the Divine's command and therefore it is my duty to do so", so that the state of remembrance should continue steadfast.
When surrender is perfect the idea of surrender itself is gone, and it becomes completely natural.
Acquiring mastery over a certain condition is nothing but merging in it just like medicine which gets dissolved into the body of a man.
When we surrender ourselves to the Great Master we begin to attract a constant flow of the highest Divine force from Him.
The best way of surrender which I have stated is to "Feel Dependence Upon God".
Thought when purely Divine, can reach the Source without fail.

How do we know that our Surrender is complete?
It is when we begin to know that the abhyasi is surrendering naturally to all humanity.
It is really the state of self-surrender in which one, as a true devotee, surrenders himself completely to the will of God, the Master, basking in the sunshine of His Grace.
Somehow if we become subtle as He(God) is, it means union.
To effect the surrender of heart in the easiest way, only an act of will is required.
Love Him who loves all, and thus everybody is automatically loved through Him.
Mould your living so as to rouse a feeling of love and piety in others.

Our dealings must be moulded, with due regard to proper needs and fair right of everyone, and bring them in close conformity with those of Nature.
When we inwardly develop, in and out become the same. In this way, purity begins to reign all over. Thus, we help Nature also.
There is every sense in living - not only in living but achieving the highest. The craving of the soul can be satisfied best, while one is living and existing.

Accepting turning towards the spiritual life is the beginning of life, and the highest state of it is 'Life in Life' which lies hidden in life itself.
It(Life) is a state of being which should remain permanently, as long as we live, thoroughly in contact with the Being, smelling at each step the fragrance of the Being.
As we develop in spirituality, the nature of peace also changes and, in the end, non-peace peace, is the result.
We can only know the unknown when we become unknown ourselves.
Mind can be known by mind and Divinity can be known by Divinity.
One of the essentials in the making of a man engaged in spiritual pursuit is moderation.
The finest Divine gift, which is patrimony of the entire progeny of mankind, stands reserved just for the human being, residing in the state of moderation in all respects.
Moderation really means that we have entered the sphere where our restless tendencies have subsided to a great extent.
The way of life should be pregnant with high morals.
If we are in the hands of a real master, all the things necessary for 'man to be called man' gradually come out of themselves.
Faith, in true sense, is a lively link connecting the mortal with the Immortal.
We should have good heart for all human beings. Then the power will run to them automatically.
We should give our due consideration and try to improve the lot of the unvirtuous also, who may feel the thirst for the Real and develop yielding attitude to the Master.
The background of spirituality is the "Moral Courage" which rises when one is moral.
What is morality in the True Sense? It is that all the faculties may come in harmony for proper use.
Once Divinity dawns, the negative attitude to life goes far away.
Realization is not possible unless moderation and balance are restored.
When you have played your part fully well, the Ultimate cannot fall short in playing His part.
To cultivate moderation we have to pay special attention to external ways of life too.

I may say here that Reality is not the field for cowards. Lion-heated men alone can dare approach Reality and men are made so, by Natural Path.

Under the Sahaj Marg system of spiritual training, the action of senses is regulated in a natural way so as to bring them to their original state, i.e. just as it was when we assumed the human form for the first time.

At bed time, feeling the presence of God, repent for the wrongs committed unknowingly. Beg forgiveness in a supplicant mood, resolving not to allow the repetition of the same.
The most important and unfailing means of success is Prayer.

The prayer must be offered in such a way as if some most miserable man is laying down his miseries with a deeply afflicted heart before the Supreme Master, imploring His mercy and grace, with tearful eyes.
We must snatch a few minutes from our hours of rest (preferably at bed-time) and pray to God with a sincere heart for His guidance and support on the path of duty.

God is the real Guru or Master and we get Light from Him alone.
When He has come to know that someone happens to be His real Seeker and Lover, then it would become a sure condition for His coming close to you.

Really the path nearest to yourself is the path nearest to God. My revered master, Samarth Guru Mahatma Ram Chandraji Maharaj of Fatehgarh, has rendered wonderful service to humanity in this respect by providing the easiest means of gaining the object of life.
The blissful time ushered in by His advent introduced a new era of spiritual awakening which promises a practical solution of the human problem of existence.

Performing of Sandhya before sunrise is stressed upon for the reason that the external heat and other influences, which have been driven out of the body, may not creep in again by the effect of the sun which would prevent our deriving the best advantage of the time.
